title: If the relation between x and y is 3x-2y=12 and the arithmetic mean of x is 6, what is the arithmetic mean of y? - Quora

response.answer_text: Given 3x-2y=12 Assuming there are same number of scores in both x and y we can take means for the hole equation and taking expectation throughout the equation. Expectation is a linear operator so expectation of an expression is sum of expectations. E(3x-2y)=E(12) E(3x)-E(2y)=12 3E(x)-2E(y)=12 Here expectation and arithmetic means are similar terms. So, E(x)=6 On substituting, 3*6–2E(y)=12 18–2E(y)=12 2E(y)=18–12 2E(y)=6 E(y)=6/2 E(y)=3
